r1.paperName: Handling multicriteria fuzzy decision-making problems based on vague set theory
r1.original citing context:
Recently, Chen et al. [5] presented some new techniques for handling multicriteria fuzzy decision-making
problems based on vague set theory, where the characteristics of the alternatives are presented by vague sets.
r1.citation citing context: An important problem is the comparison of IFVs. Therefore, the specific methods which are rather of heuristic nature were developed to compare IFVs. For this purpose, Chen and Tan [5] proposed to use the so-called score function (or net membership)

r2.paperName: Comparison between lattice Boltzmann method and Navier-Stokes high order schemes for computational aeroacoustics
r2.original citing context:

r2.original citing context:
Early methods for haze removal mainly rely on additional
depth information or multiple observations of the same
scene. Representative works include [11], [9], [10], [12].
Schechner et al. [11] notice that the airlight scattered by
atmospheric particles is partially polarized.
r2.citation citing context:
The physical model is given as follows [2]:
Ic (x)=Jc T(x)+Ac(1−T(x))
hazy haze−free r t r (1)
where c ∈ {r, g, b} is the color channel, Ic is the captured hazy
hazy image, Jc is the haze-free image, Ac is the atmos- haze−free t
pheric light, Tr is the transmission medium, and x is a pixel position. The transmission describes the portion of light, directly reaching the camera without scattering.

r1.citation citing context: In order to provide better support for future mobile applications and provide users with lower latency and better services, Multi-access Edge Computing (MEC) came into being [1]

r2.original citing context:

a cloudlet is deployed at a BS, a certain cost will be consumed.
r2.citation citing context: due to the dynamic changes of network states and the limitation of operating cost, how to deploy MEC nodes is still an urgent issue to be addressed [11].

r3.paperName: Optimal Placement of Cloudlets for Access Delay Minimization in SDN-Based Internet of Things Networks
r3.original citing context:
In [17], it is defined that the average cloudlet access
delay as the whole average service time (an M/M/1 queue for
each AP is assumed), and the cloudlet processing time as well
as flow traversing time are not considered, which is not very
practical. Zhao et al. [17] proposed a ranking-based heuristic to deploy K cloudlets to minimize the average cloudlet
access delay.
r3.citation citing context: The traditional MEC node placement strategy is to place resource- rich servers at access points in a network. The authors in [4] and [5] study the cloudlet placement problem to minimize the average access delay.

r4.paperName: Optimal Cloudlet Placement and User to Cloudlet Allocation in Wireless Metropolitan Area Networks
r4.original citing context:
Jia et al. [14] studied how to place K cloudlets and allocate user to cloudlets in wireless metropolitan area networks (WMAN) such that the average system response time is minimized. In [14], the cloudlets are modeled as an M/M/c queue
and the requested tasks of users arrive according to the Poisson
process. They [14] further propose a density-based clustering (DBC) algorithm to solve this problem
r4.citation citing context: The authors in [4] and [5] study the cloudlet placement problem to minimize the average access delay.
